segments.text: The boy is so focused on those cookies, he doesn’t even see how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he’s just reaching further like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but admire his determination, even if it’s stupid.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share like she’s done this before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying that plate, completely missing the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting closer to the stool, and it’s just a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to tell them to stop, but I don’t want to ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light is coming through the window, it almost makes the scene look peaceful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the reality is, this is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know I should.
segments.speaker: PAR
